page.title: 04BUGLAWTON HALL SCHOOL
page.content: Buglawton Hall School used to be a hunting lodge about 400 years ago.People came to stay the night there when they went hunting at Wildboarclough.Over the years it changed into a farm and then into a hall.In 1950 Manchester City Council bought it and converted it into a school for boys with discipline problems.There were two rooms for the butler.They were both small pantries ,and there was a family room.There was a stage on which the family would perform.There were some stables and the groom used to sleep above.Now there are only 6 classrooms in the school.When building is done, it has to be done with the original materials.If it is not the builders are fined.When Manchester bought it, it cost Â£50,000 .Today it would cost about half a million pounds.
